Description: Terracotta model askos. A miniature askos, perhaps a toy. Probably hand-modelled. Micaceous pinkish-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. For larger mould-made terracotta jugs of this shape, see several examples in Edgar 1911: pl. xxi, and also Pagenstecher 1913: 76–8, which are dated late Hellenistic to early Roman. Compare the jug depicted in 3543 in Chapter 9. A bronze example shown on the emblema of a mosaic of the early second century bc from a house at Chatby in Alexandria has similar characteristics (Grimm 1997: 461, fig. 7a, and Walker and Higgs 2001: 88, no. 95, where it is dated c.200–150 bc).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3669)
